verses.verse: Wherefore leaving<WG863> the doctrine<WG3056> of<WG746> the first principles<WG746> of Christ<WG5547>, let us press on<WG5342> unto<WG1909> perfection<WG5047>; not<WG3361> laying<WG2598> again<WG3825> a foundation<WG2310> of repentance<WG3341> from<WG575> dead<WG3498> works<WG2041>, and<WG2532> of faith<WG4102> toward<WG1909> God<WG2316>,

of the teaching<WG1322> of baptisms<WG909>, and<WG5037> of laying on<WG1936> of hands<WG5495>, and<WG5037> of resurrection<WG386> of the dead<WG3498>, and<WG2532> of<WG2917> eternal<WG166> judgment<WG2917>.
And <WG2532> this<WG5124> will we do<WG4160>, if<WG1437> God<WG2316> permit<WG2010>.

For <WG1063> as touching those who were<WG5461> once<WG530> enlightened<WG5461> and<WG5037> tasted<WG1089> of the<WG1431> heavenly<WG2032> gift<WG1431>, and<WG2532> were made<WG1096> partakers<WG3353> of the<WG4151> Holy<WG40> Spirit<WG4151>,
and <WG2532> tasted<WG1089> the<WG4487> good<WG2570> word<WG4487> of God<WG2316>, and<WG5037> the powers<WG1411> of the age<WG165> to come<WG3195>,

and <WG2532> then fell away<WG3895>, it is impossible<WG102> to renew them<WG340> again<WG3825> unto<WG1519> repentance<WG3341>; seeing they crucify<WG388> to themselves<WG1438> the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316> afresh<WG388>, and<WG2532> put him to an open shame<WG3856>.

For <WG1063> the land<WG1093> which<WG3588> hath drunk<WG4095> the rain<WG5205> that cometh<WG2064> oft<WG4178> upon<WG1909> it<WG846>, and<WG2532> bringeth forth<WG5088> herbs<WG1008> meet<WG2111> for them1565, 2532 for<WG1223> whose<WG3739> sake it is also tilled<WG1090>, receiveth<WG3335> blessing<WG2129> from<WG575> God<WG2316>:

but <WG1161> if it beareth<WG1627> thorns<WG173> and<WG2532> thistles<WG5146>, it is rejected<WG96> and<WG2532> nigh unto<WG1451> a curse<WG2671>; whose<WG3739> end<WG5056> is to<WG1519> be burned<WG2740>.

But <WG1161>, beloved<WG27>, we are persuaded<WG3982> better things<WG2909> of<WG4012> you<WG5216>, and<WG2532> things that accompany<WG2192> salvation<WG1487>, though<WG2532> we<WG2980> thus<WG3779> speak<WG2980>:

for <WG1063> God<WG2316> is not<WG3756> unrighteous<WG94> to forget<WG1950> your<WG5216> work<WG2041> and<WG2532> the<WG2873> love<WG26> which<WG3739> ye showed<WG1731> toward<WG1519> his<WG846> name<WG3686>, in that ye ministered<WG1247> unto the saints<WG40>, and<WG2532> still do minister<WG1247>.

And <WG1161> we desire that<WG1937> each one<WG1538> of you<WG5216> may show<WG1731> the<WG4710> same<WG846> diligence<WG4710> unto<WG891> the fulness<WG4136> of hope<WG1680> even to<WG4314> the end<WG5056>:

that <WG2443> ye be<WG1096> not<WG3361> sluggish<WG3576>, but<WG1161> imitators<WG3402> of them who<WG2816> through<WG1223> faith<WG4102> and<WG2532> patience<WG3115> inherit<WG2816> the promises<WG1860>.

For <WG1063> when<WG1861> God<WG2316> made promise<WG1861> to Abraham<WG11>, since<WG1893> he could<WG2192> swear<WG3660> by<WG2596> none<WG3762> greater<WG3173>, he sware<WG3660> by<WG2596> himself<WG1438>,
saying <WG2229>, Surely<WG3375> blessing<WG2127> I will bless<WG2127> thee<WG4571>, and<WG2532> multiplying<WG4129> I will multiply<WG4129> thee<WG4571>.
And <WG2532> thus<WG3779>, having patiently endured<WG3114>, he obtained<WG2013> the promise<WG1860>.

For <WG1063> men444, Ezekiel3 swear<WG3660> by<WG2596> the greater<WG3187>: and<WG2532> in every<WG3956> dispute<WG485> of theirs<WG846> the oath<WG3727> is final<WG4009> for<WG1519> confirmation<WG951>.

Wherein3739, 1722 God<WG2316>, being minded<WG1014> to show<WG1925> more abundantly<WG4054> unto the heirs<WG2818> of the promise<WG1860> the immutability<WG276> of<WG1012> his<WG846> counsel<WG1012>, interposed<WG3315> with an oath<WG3727>;

that <WG2443> by<WG1223> two<WG1417> immutable<WG276> things<WG4229>, in<WG1722> which<WG3739> it is impossible<WG102> for God<WG2316> to lie<WG5574>, we may have<WG2192> a<WG3874> strong<WG2478> encouragement<WG3874>, who have fled for refuge<WG2703> to lay hold<WG2902> of the hope<WG1680> set before us<WG4295>:

which <WG3739> we have<WG2192> as<WG5613> an anchor<WG45> of the soul<WG5590>, a hope both<WG5037> sure<WG804> and<WG2532> stedfast<WG949> and<WG2532> entering<WG1525> into<WG1519> that which is within<WG2082> the veil<WG2665>;

whither <WG3699> as<WG1525> a forerunner<WG4274> Jesus<WG2424> entered<WG1525> for<WG5228> us<WG2257>, having become<WG1096> a high priest<WG749> for<WG1519> ever<WG165> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Melchizedek<WG3198>.
